intro: Raukaua anomalus, commonly known as the New Zealand native tree, is a member of the Proteaceae family. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically lanceolate and have a leathery texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in the temperate climates of New Zealand, particularly in coastal and lowland regions. Raukaua anomalus is known for its ecological importance, providing habitat and food for various native wildlife species.
